Headline: Bundesliga: Erling Haaland Scores On Return From Injury As Dortmund Beat Wolfsburg
Content: Bundesliga: Erling Haaland scored on his return from injury on Saturday as Borussia Dortmund knocked Bayern Munich off top spot in the league table with a 3-1 win at Wolfsburg.

Headline: Delhi Workers Get Rs 5,000 Each As Aid Amid Construction Ban
Content: Delhi government on Saturday deposited Rs 5,000 each in  bank accounts of 2.95 lakh construction workers who have been affected by ban on construction activities in national capital in view of high pollution levels, according to an official statement

Headline: Three-Tier Security In Place For Tripura Civic Poll Counting On Sunday
Content: 3-tier security is in place for counting of votes for over 200 seats in Agartala Municipal Corporation (AMC) and other civic bodies in Tripura, where it was held on Thursday amid court cases, arrests and allegations of attacks by by political parties

Headline: FIH Men's Junior Hockey World Cup: India Trounce Poland 8-2 To Seal Quarterfinal Berth Against Belgium
Content: FIH Men's Junior Hockey World Cup: India were in top form, hammering Poland 8-2 to qualify for the quarterfinals. In the quarterfinals, the hosts will face Belgium.

Headline: Vaccine Efficacy Against New Covid Variant Under Examination: Scientist
Content: Vaccines that have been directed towards the spike protein of the virus may find difficulty in mounting adequate immunity against the mutated version because of the structural changes that have been reported in the viral genome, according to WHO.

Headline: Five Tamil Nadu Forest Department Officials "Detained" In Kerala: Police
Content: 5 forest department officials from Tamil Nadu, who had gone to Palakkad to enqure about speed of train which mowed down three elephants near Ettimadai on outskirts of the city on November 26, were reportedly detained at Palakkad railway station.

Headline: Delhi Police Busts Racket That Promised Oxygen Cylinders During Covid Second Wave
Content: The Delhi Police Cyber Cell has arrested nine members of a gang which allegedly duped around 1,000 people on the pretext of delivering medical oxygen cylinders during the second wave of COVID-19 pandemic, officials said on Saturday.

Headline: CBSE Term 1 Exam: Board Answers FAQs On Evaluation, Marking Scheme
Content: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) will hold term 1 major papers from November 30.

Headline: India vs New Zealand, 1st Test, Day 3: KS Bharat Impresses With Glove-Work, Gives Wriddhiman Saha Competition For Second Wicketkeeper Slot
Content: India vs New Zealand, 1st Test, Day 3: Due to Wriddhiman Saha's stiff neck, KS Bharat impressed as wicketkeeper for the hosts during the 85.3 overs in Kanpur.

Headline: Premier League: Arsenal Brush Aside Newcastle United As Eddie Howe Suffers First Defeat
Content: Premier League: Arsenal got back on track with a 2-0 win over Newcastle on Saturday as Eddie Howe suffered his first defeat as manager of the struggling side.

Headline: 2 Cops Suspended In Sex Racket Bust In Odisha: Police
Content: Two constables were suspended and a Sub Inspector sent to Police Line following busting of a sex racket at a hotel in Anoopshahr area, police in Bulandshahr said on Saturday.

Headline: Karnataka's New Rules For Travellers Amid 'Omicron' Variant Scare
Content: Karnataka to step up Covid screening of international passengers, RT-PCR tests for Maharashtra, Kerala visitors

Headline: 3 Killed, Nine Others Injured After Truck Rams Into Bus In Odisha
Content: At least three persons were killed and nine others were injured after a truck rammed into a bus on NH 16 in Khurda district on Saturday.

Headline: Delhi's Air Quality Recorded In "Severe" Category
Content: The air quality in Delhi was recorded in the "severe" category on Saturday due to a low wind speed that prevents effective dispersion of pollutants.

Headline: 'No Proof He Sold Drugs To Aryan Khan's Friend': Accused Gets Bail
Content: There is no apparent evidence that the accused is a peddler and had supplied drugs to co-accused Arbaaz Merchant, a special court in Mumbai said while granting bail to an accused in the drugs-on-cruise case.
